item.title: Sophie add a quote by Anne Fadiman
item.description: "Books wrote our life story, and as they accumulated on our shelves (and on our windowsills, and underneath our sofa, and on top of our refrigerator), they became chapters in it themselves." -- Anne Fadiman

item.title: Sophie add a quote by Anne Fadiman
item.description: "It has long been my belief that everyone's library contains an Odd Shelf. On this shelf rests a small, mysterious corpus of volumes whose subject matter is completely unrelated to the rest of the library, yet which, upon closer inspection, reveals a good deal about its owner." -- Anne Fadiman

item.title: Sophie add a quote by Anne Fadiman
item.description: "One reason we have children I think is to learn that parts of ourselves we had given up for dead are merely dormant and that the old joys can re emerge fresh and new and in a completely different form." -- Anne Fadiman

item.title: Sophie add a quote by Wallace Stegner
item.description: "There it was, there it is, the place where during the best time of our lives friendship had its home and happiness its headquarters." -- Wallace Stegner

item.title: Sophie add a quote by Paul Auster
item.description: "Every life is inexplicable, I kept telling myself. No matter how many facts are told, no matter how many details are given, the essential thing resists telling. To say that so and so was born here and went there, that he did this and did that, that he married this woman and had these children, that he lived, that he died, that he left behind these books or this battle or that bridge – none of that tells us very much." -- Paul Auster

item.title: Sophie add a quote by Paul Auster
item.description: "Stories only happen to those who are able to tell them." -- Paul Auster

item.title: Sophie add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "Telling me I can do anything I want is like pulling the plug out of the bath and then telling the water it can go anywhere it wants. Try it, and see what happens." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Sophie add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "The ultimate meaning to which all stories refer has two faces: the continuity of life, the inevitability of death." -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Sophie add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "Who are we, who is each one of us, if not a combinatoria of experiences, information, books we have read, things imagined?" -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Sophie add a quote by Marjane Satrapi
item.description: "It's fear that makes us lose our conscience. It's also what transforms us into cowards." -- Marjane Satrapi

item.title: Sophie add a quote by Richard Yates
item.description: "The Revolutionary Hill Estates had not been designed to accommodate a tragedy. Even at night, as if on purpose, the development held no looming shadows and no gaunt silhouettes. It was invincibly cheerful, a toyland of white and pastel houses whose bright, uncurtained windows winked blandly through a dappling of green and yellow leaves … A man running down these streets in desperate grief was indecently out of place." -- Richard Yates

item.title: Sophie add a quote by Adam Gopnik
item.description: "The loneliness of the expatriate is of an odd and complicated kind, for it is inseparable from the feeling of being free, of having escaped." -- Adam Gopnik

item.title: Sophie add a quote by Adam Gopnik
item.description: "The romance of your child's childhood may be the last romance you can give up." -- Adam Gopnik

item.title: Sophie add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "These days, Clarissa believes, you measure people first by their kindness and their capacity for devotion. You get tired, sometimes, of wit and intellect; everybody's little display of genius." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Sophie add a quote by Anne Tyler
item.description: "I'm beginning to think that maybe it's not just how much you love someone. Maybe what matters is who you are when you're with them." -- Anne Tyler

item.title: Sophie add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "The longer I live, the more uninformed I feel. Only the young have an explanation for everything." -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Sophie add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "This is to assuage our conscience, darling" she would explain to Blanca. "But it doesn't help the poor. They don't need charity; they need justice." -- Isabel Allende
